comment: 4 Tests, Lowest one dropped. 8 Lockdown browser quizzes. Full page cheat sheet allowed for every test, however he said hes stopping following this semester. Wants you to think you will fail, however he is kind of pulling leg. No phones; thick accent which may mess with comprehension. Curve 15 points if no classes missed. (Summer Semester) struggled

Dr. Kang truly cares of his students. Physics 2211 is just a very hard class! He solves problems that will be on the test. He loads study guides for each unit, 80-100 problems with solutions and the tests is usually come off those problems. He curves exams and gives so much room for extra credit! Recitation is for quiz grades every week!

As a lab professor, he's amazing, this is why I give 5 rating. He is definitely strict, but just come on time, turn in your completed lab, and don't use your phone and you'll get an A. He's pretty silly at times as well. Intimidating at first, but honestly a pretty good class for lab. His lectures, however, I've heard aren't the best.
Don't take him

His accent is difficult to understand at times but other than that, hes nice and concise. He goes over pretty much anything you could possibly need to know in the pre-lab lectures. He is seriously dead set on attendance so do not miss the labs and also very specific with how he wants you to complete the labs, but I appreciate that.

Mr. Kang was very rude to everyone. He picks on people randomly, and if you don't know the answer to his question, then he belittles you. I missed a test because my car wouldn't start, and I got a 0 for it. He doesn't compromise at all and states that it's not his problem if you can't make it to class.
Lectures are incohesive, a complete waste of time. He does allow a cheat sheet, and gives study guides, but the lectures themselves are useless. Only take if you are already confident in physics

He is definitely strict, but he is very clear about his expectations which is so refreshing. I don't think he would be great for lecture (I have heard his exams are horrific), but he is great for lab. If you come on time and don't use your phone, you will get an A. The grade is 10/11 labs (he drops the lowest) and that is it. Funny guy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Only take this professor if you have already taken a physics course. He spends the overwhelming majority of class time just doing practice problems, not actually teaching physics. When he does, he is difficult to understand, partially because of his very strong accent, and partially because he just isn't good at teaching/explaining concepts.

Do NOT take this class if you want a good class experience. The teacher is not clear on how to do labs, is very aggressive, when you ask the teacher in class when you should turn in labs, he gets mad and humiliates you in front of the class. I only took this class because it was the only lab class available when I was registering for Physics 2211L.
It was a decent class. Took some hard work to ace it. Professor was helpful outside of the class time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Super easy, just arrive on time, collect your data, leave class when you finish, and use the notes he posts online to find all your answers. The notes literally show you exactly how to get almost every answer. No phones in class, don't be loud, and you're not allowed to be 20 mins late. Drops lowest lab.

As long as you arent late and turn in everything your fine. My lowest lab was an 80 its really hard to fail his lab.He does a good prelecture,demonstrates lab,and gives you every formula you need. He does not want you to contact him outside of class but you really wont need to wtv ques. you have you'll probably find it while he does his pre-lecture

Kicked a student out for being late on the first day of class, says there's 0 tolerance for ever being late or missing class, even if you have covid just wear 2 masks and come anyway. Refuses to respond or be contacted outside of class, states that if you have trouble it's your fault for not asking questions before you leave class. Awful lecturer.

The tests are just like the examples he does in class I'm not even a studious person and was able to pass this class. the homework did not really help with what he would teach in class but it was good background information.

Dr. Kang cares about his students and wants them to gain a thorough understanding of physics. His tests are difficult but a fair representation of the problems we go over in class - and his study guides are extremely helpful in studying. Attendance and participation in class is mandatory to do well in his class.

Dr. Kang makes it so that it is possible to get an A but you're going to be pulling your hair out trying to get it. In my eyes he makes everything way more complicated than it needs to be, and he can be very confusing at times. The only good thing about this guy is his study guides IF YOU EVEN GET ONE are almost exactly like the test. GOOD LUCK
ATTEND CLASS!!!!!!!!.
This professor isn't very good at explaining the course material. Make sure you have time to read the book after lectures.

Dr. Kang's Lab is more about figuring out how he wants the format of the lab to be than doing the lab itself. He's difficult to understand and is very strict. Your lowest Lab is dropped out of 11 and it's not too hard but don't expect any kind of leeway with anything from him. The only exception is he will allow late labs for -3 points/day.

I only took Prof Kang's lab, he is VERY strict with attendance and being on time, if you have any emergency before class it's an automatic zero and -15 points for every 15 minutes if you do show up. His actual grading is really fair, generous even & he gives good feedback. Good professor but pray your car doesn't break down like mine did!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He is kind but exam are hard and a lot of studying has to be done outside of class. He calls on you randomly for participation grade.

Professor Kang's fair. Not terrible, but not great. He knows the material but doesn't explain it well, so you have to study outside of class to understand. His quizzes are online, but use LockDown Browser. Tests are curved, but don't depend on it. Test questions are similar to the study guide. You just have to study to pass, which I did but barely.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is very knowledgeable about physics but doesn't make it simple so those who aren't familiar with the subject can understand. He expects students to teach themselves material outside of class and gives extremely hard quizzes, which are taken outside of class (with lockdown browser). Recitation attendance is mandatory and includes graded quizzes.

You learn little in class, most of the learning is done by studying outside of class or with a tutor but attendance is graded. You get reported for missing over 3 days of class in a month &you fail tests/quizzes. He will shoot you down if your'e wrong when answering lecture questions. There is little material to study for quizzes and tests. RUN
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Graded by few things
